title: Monomania
summary: exaggerated or obsessive enthusiasm for or preoccupation with one thing

title: Surfeit
summary: an excessive amount of something

title: Gnostics
summary: relating to knowledge, especially esoteric mystical knowledge

title: Dint
summary: an impression or hollow in a surface

title: Proffer
summary: hold out (something) to someone for acceptance; offer

title: Anathema
summary: something or someone that one vehemently dislikes

title: Neophyte
summary: a person who is new to a subject, skill, or belief

title: Lacuna
summary: an unfilled space or interval; a gap

title: Abetted
summary: encourage or assist (someone) to do something wrong, in particular, to commit a crime or other offense

title: Spivs
summary: a man, typically characterized by flashy dress, who makes a living by disreputable dealings

title: Teetotaler
summary: a person who never drinks alcohol

title: Sycophantic
summary: behaving or done in an obsequious way in order to gain advantage

title: Sanctimonious
summary: making a show of being morally superior to other people

title: Effeminate
summary: (of a man) having or showing characteristics regarded as typical of a woman; unmanly

title: Reticence
summary: the quality of being reticent; reserve

title: Sinewy

title: Trattorias

title: Languorous

title: Avuncular

title: Vaunted

title: Wantonly

title: Quell

title: Debentures

title: Paradigmatic
summary: of the nature of a paradigm or model

title: Prurient

title: Histrionic
summary: overly theatrical or melodramatic in character or style

title: Abrogation
summary: The verbs abrogate and arrogate are quite different in meaning. While abrogate means ‘repeal (a law),’ arrogate means ‘take or claim (something) for oneself without justification,’ often in the structure arrogate something to oneself, as in the emergency committee arrogated to itself whatever powers it chose.

title: Prevaricated

title: Pliable

title: Magnanimous

title: Ennui

summary: a person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage

title: Paraffin

title: Tamarisks

summary: especially impossible to chew

a state of eternal punishment and damnation into which a sinful and unpenitent person passes after death.

title: Panacea

title: Monastic

title: Perambulation

title: Gaunt

title: Miasma
